hinttip.desc: Enter your username. The default is admin
Enter your password. The default is admin and should be changed once you login.
Login in Mobile Data Now.
If you forget your password, enter your username and then click here and a new password will be sent to your email address.
Select the language you want to change Mobile Data Now to.
The name of your project. eg CRM Project
A description of your project.
This tree lists your projects.
Opens a project after selecting it above.
Create a new project.
Import an existing project.
Export your project to an xml file.
Logout from Mobile Data Now.
Access the general settings for Mobile Data Now.
Show details of your licensing, installation reference and email address.
Open the projects window to manage your projects.
Information to contact a reseller to purchase more licenses.
Open the event log which shows activity of each messaging tool.
Opens and closes the help window.
Enter a name for the database you wish to access. This will appear on the database tree for your reference. eg Business Data.

Choose an appropriate database driver to connect your database to. e.g. JDBC/ODBC Bridge. If the database driver you need is not present, go to Settings then Database Drivers to add an appropriate driver

Enter the database URL. The format of the URL for this database driver should be entered as shown in the example to the right. Please see the configuration guide for further details about connecting to databases.
Add in the schema name for the database. eg biz
Some databases may require the input of a User & Password in order to login. If so, then enter the username here, otherwise leave blank.
Some databases may require the input of a User & Password in order to login. If so, then enter the password here, otherwise leave blank.
Test the connection between the server Mobile Data Now is installed on and the server hosting the database.
Saves the connection.
Clears the data from this screen so you can re-enter the data.
Lists the tables in the database and their properties. For informational purposes only. If you need to make changes to your database, please use an appropriate database administration tool.
The table name. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
The table description. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
Lists the fields in the database and their properties. For informational purposes only. If you need to make changes to your database, please use an appropriate database administration tool.
The field name. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
The field type. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
The field size. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
The decimal digits for this field. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
If this field contains a unique key, this will be ticked. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
If this field is read only, this will be ticked. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.
A description of the field. This is for display purposes only and is not editable in Mobile Data Now.

Views are used to simplify and organize the table data. For example, you might be accessing multiple databases with many tables, so Views help you sort out and simplify which tables will be accessed and used. By creating a View, you select a subset of tables in the database to use rather than using all the tables.
Enter a name for the View you wish to create. eg Orders for Customers
Enter a description of the View you wish to create.
The database tree shows the database tables and fields along with checkboxes next to each. Tick the tables and fields you want to be included in this view.
If this checkbox is ticked, the tree will show only the tables and fields in the view you have created.
This shows the field details when selected on the tree.
The name of the selected field.
Write an optional description of the contents of the field.
You may wish to change each field name to a more friendly name when users receive query results if the field name is confusing. eg 'CtName' to 'Contact Name'
Saves the database view.
Saves the field description and display name changes.
Enter the users first name.
Enter the users last name.
Enter a username for the user here. This is used if the user is to be given login priviliges
Enter a password for this user.
Enter a new password for this user if their old password is to be changed.
Select if this user is to be given login privileges to Mobile Data Now (Administrator), or if they are a common user without login privileges.
Choose a group this user will be part of. You can also drag a user(s) to the appropriate group. Data access privileges are set within each group screen.
Enter any relevant notes about this user.
Enter the email address the user will send email queries from and receive email queries to.
Enter the mobile phone number the user will send SMS queries from and receive SMS queries to. NOTE: The mobile number must be in international format.
Enter the instant messaging username/contact the user will send instant messaging queries from and receive instant messaging queries to.
Saves this information about the user.
Create a system variable which can be used in queries, assign them to individual users and then filter based on this criteria. eg. EmployeeID. See the help for more details.
To delete a query value, select an existing one and press the delete button.
Choose a parameter for this user which has previously been setup in the Custom Query Values screen and assign an appropriate value.
Enter a query value which can be used in generic queries so only information relevant to the end-user is sent back. eg. EmployeeID, UserID, StudentID.
This screen shows each message sent and received by the user.
Choose a name for this group. Users in this group are given data access permission based on which tables and fields are selected below.
To enable users in this group to view data, tick the appropriate boxes. Any boxes not ticked will not enable the user to view data from that table or field.
Saves the group settings.
This screen shows all the messages sent and received by the group.
Tick this box if you wish this group to be accessed by anyone (any member of the public).
The properites tab shows details of the data source and query type for this query.
Enter a name for this query.
Enter a description about what this query does.
Select the datasource you will use for this query.

Select the type of query you wish to use.

SELECT = retrieves existing record,

UPDATE = updates an existing record,

INSERT = creates a new record.
The SELECT query retrieves an existing record.
The UPDATE query updates an existing record.
The INSERT query creates a new record.
Select the database you will use for this query.
Choose the view you want to use for this query.
Choose the table you need to insert the new record in to.
If you intended to use User Replies, enter a timeout value in seconds that a user has to reply in, otherwise the message times out.
Construct your queries here.

Select how you want to choose the records:

ALL = All of the conditions must be satisfied (Logical AND)

ANY = At least one of the conditions must be satisfied (Logical OR)

NONE = Record is rejected if any of the conditions are satisfied (Logical AND-NOT)

NOT ALL = Record is included if at least one of the conditions is false. If all of them are met, the record is rejected (Logical OR-NOT).
Enable or disable a condition.

The number of the condition. Click on this to get a submenu with options: Add Condition (after current), to add a new condition; Add Bracket (after current), to add a bracket with a new condition on how to choose records; Delete Current Row, to delete the row; Enable/Disable Row, to enable or disable a row.
Choose a field to use from your selected view or table.
Select the logical operator you need to use.

Select the appropriate value.

Value: Enter any value.

Custom User: A value which is unique to each user, such as a User ID or username/password for that user. These need to be defined in the users section of Users & Groups.

User Input: This is a value the user will enter to get their query results. You can define many user inputs but they must be entered by the user in the order they are setup here to return the correct query results.

Calendar: Choose a date.

Boolean: Condition is true or false.
Define the records which need to be updated based on conditions below. eg. daily task from [UserInput] updates the daily task from the user subject to conditions defined below.
After you have created a query, this area allows you to sort the results to display as you like.
Select the field to work with. Indicated by table.field.

Select if you want the results in ascending or descending order. A Sort has a Field and a direction. Sorting is alphabetical based on the field that you have specified. An Ascending sort will sort from A-Z, Descending from Z-A.

Shows the order of the sort.

If you have more than one sort they are applied hierarchically. The first sort is the primary one, and where there are several records with the same value for the first sort field, they will be sorted on the second Sort field. You can choose the priority by which they are sorted with the arrow keys to the right.
Adds a sort condition.
Deletes a sort condition.

This allows you to group your query by a field in the view. Select the desired field or none if grouping is not required. When the mobile user executes this query it will show a unique list of the values of the grouping field. When they request one of these records it will show them a list of the records that have that value in the grouping field.
Here you can select which email address, instant messaging name or mobile number to query the data source with. Additionally you can select how to separate each user input.

This email address is where users send queries to, and is used to send the results back to users. Select an email address to be used for this query. If you have not setup an email address yet, select 'Add New' and you will be promoted to setup an email address for this query. You may setup unique email addresses for each query, with or without a keyword.

This SMS number is where users send queries to, and is used to send the results back to users. Select an SMS number to be used for this query. If you have not setup an SMS number yet, select 'Add New' and you will be promoted to setup an SMS number for this query. You can only use one SMS number to send all queries to, so you need to use keywords to distinguish between queries.

This instant messaging name is where users send queries to, and is used to send the results back to users. Select an instant messaging name to be used for this query. If you have not setup an instant messaging name yet, select 'Add New' and you will be promoted to setup an instant messaging name for this query. You can only use one instant messaging name per network to send all queries to, so you need to use keywords to distinguish between queries.

Enter a keyword which is unique to this query.

A keyword is used to specify which query is executed where there is only one email address, SMS number or instant messaging name used for all queries. If unique email addresses are used for each query, then keywords are not necessary for each email address. SMS numbers and instant messaging names are limited to one of each, so you need to use keywords for these to distinguish between queries.
Enter a number to determine how many results to return from the query. Be mindful that displays on mobile devices are small and 1-2 results are probably enough.
Here you decide how each User Input condition will be separated when entered by an end user. If you used commas, the entry would be like [Keyword],[UserInput 1],[UserInput 2] etc.
Edit the format of the message which is sent back to the user when they query the database.
Edit the format of the message which is sent back to the user when they send an incorrectly formatted query to the database.

A Direct SQL query is a free-form query that may be created by the database administrator and include more complex SQL than is supported by the Mobile Data Now query wizard. You first need to save the query, then select it in the tree to use the Direct SQL option. Type the query you wish to execute in the SQL query field.
Click to test your query and view the results below.
Saves the query. You will need to save the query each time you make changes to it.
Restores the default tables and field results.
Steps back to the message format you had before saving.
This tab shows the results of running the query with all the data.
This tab shows the typical result the end user will receive when they request the query.
This tab shows the SQL language. You can change this manually instead of using the query builder.
Test your query.
Use this to test your query for email.
Use this to test your query for SMS.
Use this to test your query for IM.
Enter the query as an end user would. Make sure you use the correct separator from the settings in between each parameter.
Setup User Replies below so users can query more information from an initial query.
This is the reply the end user would enter to execute the query. eg 'Yes' or 'No' or a user input from the query screen.
Enter a description for this user reply.
If the user does not return a reply in the time stated, the query times out.
This is the default format of the response, taken from the View. Edit it as appropriate with free form text or use fields contained within percent marks.
This is the reference number of the installation. It is used when purchasing a license so that the license is attributed to the correct user and installation.
This is your registered email address.
Select the language below and press Apply.
Apply the selected language to the Mobile Data Now user interface.
Enter the name of the language you want to add.
Browse for your translated xml language file in your file system.
Upload your new language file to Mobile Data Now.

Select the database driver to connect to. A database driver is used to access data located in different location or systems. \nYou can also install additional drivers by clicking the button 'Import Driver'
Enter a name for the database driver. e.g. ODBC/JDBC Driver.
Enter the url of the driver to connect to.
Write a description of the driver for your own reference.
Add a new database driver.
Update an existing database driver.
Clear the properties of an existing database driver.
Delete an existing database driver from the database list.

You need to select an appropriate separator for the data you will use. For example, if you select 'space' you will need to be aware that entering data which has two arguments separated by a space in a single userinput, will not work properly.
Your queries will be separated by a space. eg [userinput1] [userinput2] [userinput3] etc.
Your queries will be separated by a comma. eg [userinput1],[userinput2],[userinput3] etc.
Your queries will be separated by a semi-colon. eg [userinput1];[userinput2];[userinput3] etc.
Your queries will be separated by your own choice. eg, a fullstop. [userinput1].[userinput2].[userinput3] etc.
Save the settings.
During your trial you have 200 free messages for each type of messaging service. These are counted here. Once these run out, you will need to purchase credits to keep using public messaging.
This counts how many public messages have been received by your installation of Mobile Data Now.
To prevent abuse, Mobile Data Now can permanently or temporarily block users from sending queries. Enter the details appropriate to your situation.

This screen lets you define a word end-users can send in to remind them of the keywords they can use. The default is currently 'help' and when a user sends in this query, it will return a list of keywords. If a user sends in 'help keyword' where keyword is one of the results sent back, the result will return a description of the keyword.
Enter the email address that users will send queries to, and receive replies from.
Enter the SMTP host name (outgoing).
Enter the IMAP host name (incoming).
Enter the username for this email address.
Enter the password for this email address.
Save the settings.
If you use SSL or TLS select the appropriate encryption type.
Select your port, by default IMAP is 143 and SMTP is 25.
Enter the instant messaging name that users will send queries to, and receive replies from.
Enter the instant messaging user id/login name.
Enter the instant messaging password.
Select the instant messaging network to connect to for the instant messaging ID.
Save the settings. Next you need to select the IM connection you just created and on that screen, press the 'Connect' button to connect to the network.
To use this instant messaging ID, you need to connect to its network by pressing the connect button.
Shows the status of the connection, if it is connected or disconnected and for how long.
Enter the phone number of the SIM card. This needs to be in the format: (country code)number, leaving out any zeros at the beginning of the mobile number.
Enter the com port used eg. COM1
Select the baudrate for the modem eg. 9600
Enter the manufacturer name.
Enter the model number of the modem.
Save the connection. Next you need to select the SMS connection you just created and on that screen, press the 'Connect' button to connect the modem.
To use this SMS Modem, you need to connect to the phone network by pressing the connect button.
Enter the mobile number MSISN,APN your SMPP service provider has given you. This must be in international format.
Enter the host address your provider has given you.
Enter the port number your SMPP service provider has given you.
Enter the username and password your SMPP service provider has given you.
Enter the Source NPI number your SMPP service provider has given you. The will usually be 1.
Enter the Source TON number your SMPP service provider has given you. This will usually be 1.
Ticking this box makes the SMPP provider use the mobile number as the reply number if it does not do this by default.

Concatenated messages are individual messages joined together to make them look as one long message. Most modern mobile phones support concatenation and you will need to find out from your SMPP provider whether they use TLV or UDH to concatenate messages.
Some providers require a link to be sent periodically to keep the connection alive. Enter the time period here.
Select the colour to change Mobile Data Now to.
Select which users and/or groups are to receive the deployment email, which details how they can query the data sources.
Sends the deployment email to the users.
Enter the name of the person who the email is from.
Enter the senders email address.
Enter the subject of the email.
Type how you want the email to read to your users. Some basic information has already been included.
Shows the maximum number of users licensed for this installation of Mobile Data Now. You can add more users buy purchasing additional users licenses through the 'User Licenses' link.
Buy additional users for your installation of Mobile Data Now.
Indicates the number of days left before the license expires and the need to re-purchase the license. If this is a perpetual license, you never need to re-purchase a license.
